item.content:encoded: West Burton Chapel would like to remind people living in the Parish of Burton-cum-Walden that grants will be available later in the year from the West Burton Chapel Wallace Education Fund for anyone going into further education. For further details please contact Julie Pledge on 01969 663481 or Irene Dent on 01969 663339.

item.content:encoded: Due to current advice from Government, relating to Covid-19, meetings of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will take place via Zoom, during April 2021. The situation will be reviewed at the end of April.

item.title: Recipe Book
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
Did you know there's a recipe book available? It has been compiled from favourite recipes donated by the residents of the parish. It was published in 2010 and contains nearly 80 pages and over 100 recipes from Yorkshire and other exotic locations such as Sweden, the Czech Republic and Holland! It makes an ideal present for special occasions, or a memento of your visit to our village.

The book is on sale in West Burton at the village shop, Hartle's Butcher's shop and the Fox and Hounds Inn. It costs only 6 or a special price of 5 for two or more copies.  Copies can also be obtained by post (cost of postage and packaging - 1.50). Enquiries to sueryding@hotmail.co.uk.

item.title: Minutes - 7th Jul 2020
item.dc:creator: wbpc-administrator
item.content:encoded:
The Annual Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 7 July 2020.  This meeting had been scheduled for 5 May 2020 but had been delayed due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Ms Beth Daley, Mr Rowland Dent, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk

1.  Election of Chairman

Councillor Beth Daley proposed and Councillor Sally Sahin seconded, that Councillor Jane Ritchie should be elected as Chairman, and this was passed unanimously.  Councillor Jane Ritchie then signed the Declaration of Acceptance of Office.

2.  Risk Assessment for the meeting

A Risk Assessment for the use of the Village Hall for meetings of the Council during the Covid-19 pandemic was considered.

RESOLVED:  That the Risk Assessment is approved

3.  Apologies

There were no apologies, all the members being present.

4.  Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest

5.  Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 3 March 2020, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman

6.  Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Plinths at the entrances to the village
  • Repair of the flat swings
  • Council finances

RESOLVED:  That the stone to be used for the new plinths should be the random tumbled'

7.  Nomination of Councillors to Committees, Working Groups and other organisations

RESOLVED:  That the Council would be represented on committees, groups and other organisations as follows:

  • Aysgarth Cemetery Committee Cllrs Rowland Dent and Sally Sahin
  • Upper Dales Health Watch Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • RDC Upper Dales Area Partnership Board Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • Village Hall Committee Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • Emergency Working Group Cllr Andrew Landau
  • YLCA Cllr Beth Daley and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
  • Fundraising Group Cllrs Jane Ritchie and Sally Sahin and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
  • Rights of Way working group Cllrs Jane Ritchie and Beth Daley and the Clerk, Sue Ryding

8.  Trustees of West Burton Charity

The Council considered nominations for trustees for the West Burton Charity

RESOLVED:  That Councillor Jane Ritchie and Mrs Gail Dent should remain as trustees

9.  Internal scrutiny of the Council's finances

RESOLVED:  That Councillors Andrew Landau and Beth Daley are appointed to scrutinise the Council's finances.

10.  Internal Audit Report

The Internal Audit Report from Mrs Pauline Beckett was considered, having been circulated before the meeting.  The Council also considered an invoice from Mrs Beckett for 20.00

RESOLVED:  That the comments are duly noted and that a cheque for 20.00 should be duly signed

11.  Annual Return

The Annual Return and accompanying documents were examined following the Internal Audit carried out on 11 June 2020.

RESOLVED: That the Annual Return, and accompanying documents should be accepted and adopted, and that the Annual Return should be completed as follows:

  • Certificate of exemption
  • Section 1 Annual governance statement 2019/20
  • Bank reconciliation as at 31 March 2020
  • Explanation of significant variations for the year ending 31 March 2020
  • Section 2 Accounting statements 2019/20

12.  Code of Conduct for Councillors

A consultation request on the draft Model Member Code of Conduct was considered and the survey completed.

RESOLVED:  That the completed survey should be forwarded to the National Association of Local Councils

13.  Vacancy at Cavey Garth

Councillors considered an email from Sanctuary Housing with details of two bidders for the vacant property at Cavey Garth. 

RESOLVED: That Sanctuary Housing should be informed that the Council felt that Ruth Boddy has the stronger local link and is recommended for the vacancy

14.  Removal of laybys on the A684

Councillors considered proposals from North Yorkshire County Council for the removal of laybys on the A684 under the Safer Roads Scheme.

RESOLVED:  That the Clerk should complete and return the survey, with a copy to Councillor Yvonne Peacock, saying that the Council felt there was insufficient information as to exactly which laybys are to be removed, but that most of them should remain, to alleviate parking congestion in other areas.  In particularly, the layby near the Aysgarth Surgery should remain, as should the layby alongside the AA Box.  However, the Council supported the removal of laybys where access in and out was considered to be a hazard.

15.  Safety measures for re-opening the play area on the Village Green

The Council considered the practical measures that could be taken during the Covid-19 pandemic for the safe re-opening of play area.  Councillor Beth Daley reported that she had placed temporary safety signage on the equipment pending the meeting.

RESOLVED:  That the signage is approved and should remain and that Councillor Daley is thanked for this initiative

16.  Complaint about congestion on the Front Nook

Councillors considered a complaint received about vehicles parking on the Front Nook and causing congestion when larger vehicles were trying to get through.

RESOLVED:  That the Clerk should contact the owners of the vehicles and ask them to park more considerately

17.  Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices had been signed earlier.

  • J W Alderson & Sons - 60.00 (VAT 9.99)
  • West Burton Village Hall - 15.00

18.  Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meeting attended.

19.  Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there are no additional items that should be brought forward to the next agenda.  Councillors also resolved that the next meeting should be held on 6 October unless circumstances required another meeting sooner.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.50 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 6 October at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

                                                                                                Chairman:  J O Ritchie

                                                                                                Date: 6 October 2020

item.title: Minutes - 6th Oct 2020
item.dc:creator: wbpc-administrator
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 6 October 2020. Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Ms Beth Daley, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk Also present: Councillor Yvonne Peacock of Richmondshire District Council and North Yorkshire County Council   1. Apologies Apologies were received and accepted from Councillor Rowland Dent.   2. Declarations of interest Councillor Beth Daley declared a personal interest in Item 8.   3. Minutes The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 7 July 2020, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman   4. Clerk's Report The Clerk gave a verbal report on matters arising from the previous meeting.   The Council considered Planning Application R54/163/OH for the renewal of the overhead electric cable at Walden Head, the details of which had been circulated before the meeting. RESOLVED: That the Council supports the approval of this application   5. Arrangements for Bonfire Night and Christmas The Council consider the feasibility of some kind of celebration for Bonfire Night and Christmas in the light of the current coronavirus pandemic. RESOLVED: That all arrangements for Bonfire Night should be cancelled, but that the Clerk should order the Christmas tree and make the arrangements for it to be put up as usual. There would be no switch on event, but the Clerk was asked to put an item in the next Newsletter explaining the decision on both events and suggesting residents might like to display as many Christmas lights as possible   6. Half-yearly review of the budget The Council considered a bank reconciliation and supporting financial information which had been circulated before the meeting. The level at which the Precept should be set was also considered. RESOLVED: That the Council accepts the documents and the recommendation of the Responsible Financial Officer that the Precept should remain unchanged at 6,600.00   7. Consultation request on Council Tax reductions Councillors considered a consultation request from Richmondshire District Council on possible Council Tax reductions RESOLVED: That Councillors did not wish to comment at this time.   8. Request to lay an electric cable across a track The Council considered a request from the owners of Mill House to lay an electric cable duct across the track leading down to the Waterfall in order to install an electric car charging point in their garage. RESOLVED: That the Council is happy to agree to this request.   9. Richmondshire District Council Area Partnership fund The Council considered if there was any outstanding project for which a grant from the RDC Area Partnership would be appropriate and could be applied for. RESOLVED: That there is no project that needs extra funding at the present time   10. Invitation for Remembrance Sunday An invitation from St Andrew's Church was considered for a representative of the Parish Council to take part in a Remembrance Sunday service on 8 November. RESOLVED: That the Council thanked the organisers of the event for their kind invitation, but was planning to hold their own small remembrance event on 11 November. The Clerk was asked to reply accordingly   11. Water tap near Cote Bridge Councillors received a report from the Chairman that the water tap that had been located near Cote Bridge had been removed and re-sited within the Cote Bridge Caravan Park. The Chairman explained that this tap had been designated in the Emergency Plan as the emergency water source for West Burton. The Council considered whether or not an emergency tap was needed and if so where it could be sited. RESOLVED: That an emergency tap would be useful and that the Chairman would consult with the owners of Cote Farm for a possible location   12. Congestion near the access to Cavey Garth Councillors considered reports of congestion near the entrance to the road to Cavey Garth that had prohibited vehicles from gaining access. In particular it was reported that the refuse collection vehicles could not reach Cavey Garth if cars were parked on the road near West Burton House. The Council also considered the idea of a temporary car park in a field near the village to alleviate the parking problem during the main tourist season. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should contact the Highways Department with a proposal that yellow lines should be installed near West Burton House to allow free access in the area to larger vehicles. The Clerk was asked to include an item in the Newsletter asking if any landowner would be willing to provide temporary car parking during the summer months.   13. Parish Clerk's salary and hours The Council considered the recommended increase in the Clerk's salary from the National Associated of Local Councils for the financial year 2020 to 2021, and whether the Clerk's contractual hours of 220 per annum were appropriate. RESOLVED: That the Clerk's hours should remain at 220 per annum, that her salary should remain as Scale Point 20 and that the hourly rate should be increased from 13.15 per hour to 13.51   14. Items for the Newsletter Councillors discussed items that should be included in the next Newsletter which is due later in October. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should duly take note of the items to be included.   15. Invoices A cheque for the following invoice was signed. J W Alderson & Sons - 80.00 (VAT 13.34)   16. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and received a report on a virtual meeting of the Richmondshire Branch of the Yorkshire Local Councils Associations from Councillor Beth Daley.   17. Circulation of documents Councillors noted that circulation of documents is not recommended practice at this time.   18. Items for the next agenda RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there are no additional items that should be brought forward to the next agenda.   There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.45 pm Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 3 November at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.  

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 3 November 2020

item.title: Minutes - 5th Jan 2021
item.dc:creator: wbpc-administrator
item.content:encoded:
A virtual Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 5 January 2021.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk

  1. Apologies

Apologies were received from Councillor Beth Daley and Councillor Rowland Dent, and the reasons for their absence were accepted and approved.

  1. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest.

 

  1. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 3 November 2020, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman

  1. Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

    • Christmas tree
    • Reading Room footpath
    • Debris in the Beck
    • Welcome packs
    • Online payments from the Council bank account
    • Clerk's salary and PAYE

RESOLVED: That cheques for 25.00 should be sent to each of the Yorkshire Air Ambulance and the Great North Air Ambulance as a donation in lieu of the cost of the electricity to power the Christmas tree lights, as arranged with the owner of the Black Bull

 

  1. Bank reconciliation and report from the RFO

The Responsible Financial Officer reported that the bank reconciliation was awaiting the arrival of the bank statement which had not yet been received. As soon as it had been received, a bank reconciliation would be circulated.

RESOLVED: That Councillors would consider the bank reconciliation in due course

 

  1. Parish Council insurance cover

The Council considered quotes from Zurich Municipal for insurance cover at a fixed cost for five years, three years or one year.

RESOLVED: That the quote for five years, at a cost of 454.85 per annum, is approved and that the Clerk should notify Zurich Municipal and obtain the appropriate invoice

  1. Internal audit of the Council finances, and appointment of an Internal Auditor

Councillors reviewed the Procedure for the Internal Audit of the Council's Finances which had been circulated before the meeting, and the appointment of an Internal Auditor.

RESOLVED: That Councillors approved the Procedure for the Internal Audit and that Mrs Pauline Beckett should be asked if she would again undertake the duties of Internal Auditor.

  1. Garden area next to the Mill

The Council considered a request from one of the owners of the Mill for the clearance of the garden area adjacent to the property which has become very overgrown.

RESOLVED: That the Council agrees that the work should be done and that the Clerk should ask Mr David Allen of the Wensleydale Tree and Horticultural Services Ltd if he would undertake the work and provide a quote

  1. Invoices

A cheque for the following invoice was signed.

    • C H Fawcett (Christmas tree) - 144.00 (VAT 24.00)

  1. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

The Chairman reported that she would be attending an online meeting of the Yorkshire Dales National Park on 20 January 2021.

 

  1. Circulation of documents

Councillors noted that circulation of documents is not recommended practice at this time.

  1. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following items should be brought forward for the next agenda

    • Repair of the track by Hartle's Butchers
    • Parking in the village during the summer months

 

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.00 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 9 March 2021 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

item.content:encoded:
A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 10 May 2022 at 7.30 pm.

Members of the public are invited to address the Council between 7.30 and 7.45 pm at the discretion of the Council.

AGENDA
  1. To elect a Chairman for the forthcoming year and to complete and sign the Declaration of Acceptance of Office.
  2. To receive apologies for absence.
  3. To receive declarations of interest.
  4. To confirm the minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 5 April 2022.
  5. To receive a report from the Clerk on the following matters:
    1. Work at the Mill
    2. Jubilee bench
    3. Planning application for Aysgarth Lodge Holidays
  6. To consider the nomination of Councillors to Committees, working groups and other organisations (copy of last year's list contained in the Clerk's report)
  7. To confirm the Trustees of West Burton Charity
  8. To consider the nomination of two Councillors to scrutinise internal aspects of the Council's finances
  9. To receive the Internal Audit report from Mrs Pauline Beckett, to consider matters arising from it and to receive an invoice for 20.00 (copy attached)
  10. To consider and complete the Annual Return
  11. To consider a draft risk assessment for the Platinum Jubilee Lunch on 5 June 2022 (to follow)
  12. To consider matters arising from the Annual Parish Meeting on 3 May 2022
  13. To consider the state of the track by the Butcher's shop
  14. To receive the following invoices for payment:
    1. Parish Caretaker to be confirmed
    2. Stationery (stamps) - 66.00
    3. J W Alderson & Sons - 104.03
  15. To receive notice of meetings and other events.
  16. To consider items for the next agenda.

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 3rd October 2023
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL MINUTES OF THE PARISH COUNCIL MEETING HELD ON TUESDAY, 3 OCTOBER 2023

A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 3 October 2023

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, and Mr David Dent, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk 1. Apologies Apologies were received, and the reason accepted, for Councillor Victoria Whitehead 2. Declarations of interest There were no declarations of interest 3. Minutes The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 5 September 2023, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman. 4. Clerk's Report The Clerk reported on the following matters: - Registration of Common Land - Repairs for Cavey Garth - Streetlight number 7 - Arrangements for Christmas - Council finances 5. Water leak outside the Chapel The Clerk reported that a leak just outside her house had now been repaired, and that this seems to have been the source of the leak outside the Chapel.as the water has now dried up. RESOLVED: That the Clerk would continue to monitor the situation to ensure that the leak outside the Chapel had stopped 6. Half-yearly review of the budget, bank reconciliation and Precept The Clerk, as the Responsible Financial Officer, reported on the Council's financial situation which was detailed in documents circulated before the meeting. There was also preliminary consideration of setting the Precept for the year 2024/5. RESOLVED: That the half-yearly report and bank reconciliation are agreed and accepted, and that the preliminary view of setting the Precept for the next financial year is that it should remain at 6,600.00 7. Statement of support for Dales Bus 856 Sunday service The Clerk tabled a request from Mrs Ruth Annison for a statement of support for the continuation of the Dales Bus 856 Sunday service which was considered by the Council. However, Councillors noted that this service does not call at West Burton. RESOLVED: That the Council did not wish to comment at this time 8. Sewage discharges in Bishopdale Beck Councillors considered information circulated by Mr Neil Smeeton taken from Yorkshire Water's own figures on sewage discharges into Bishopdale Beck RESOLVED: That the Clerk should write to the CEO of Yorkshire Water to ask for the treatment plant at Aysgarth to be upgraded to deal with the increase in rain water and discharges. 9. Offer of a do-it-yourself litter picker Councillors considered an offer from Mr John Bennett of a donation of a do-it-yourself litter picker to be sited at the Waterfall. RESOLVED: That the Council thanked Mr Bennett, but felt that the litter picker might be vandalised and might also look out of place. 10. Request for a memorial cross at the Waterfall The Council considered a request from Mr Alan Ingram, on behalf of a small walking group, for a memorial cross dedicated to one of their members who had recently died. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should reply to this request that the Council did not feel that the Waterfall area, a place for recreation and enjoying nature, was an appropriate place for a memorial cross. The Clerk was asked to reply and suggest that the group might consider a memorial bench instead. 11. Parking in West Burton The Council considered reports of cars parking on pavements which blocks the way for pedestrians, and of electric cables being run out across the Village Green to charge electric cars. The Clerk reported that she had already alerted the Parish Caretaker to this hazard and asked him to check before using the motor mower. RESOLVED: That the following is agreed: That the Clerk should put an item in the next Newsletter asking people not to park on pavements That the Clerk should contact the owners of Hazeley Garth to discuss ensuring that any cable across the Green should be much more visible That this matter should be put on the agenda for the next Annual Parish Meeting in April next year That the Clerk should ask if electric charging could be an agenda item at the next branch meeting of the Yorkshire Local Councils Association on 23 October 2023 which would be attended by Councillor David Dent and the Clerk. 12. Invoices Cheques for the following invoices were signed. Parish Caretaker - 723.60 (VAT 17.77) HarryAdney (replacement cheque) - 50.00 J W Alderson & Sons 72.00 (VAT 12.00) West Burton Village Hall - 16.00 13. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended. 14. Items for the next agenda RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there were no other items that should be brought forward to the next agenda. There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.00 pm Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 7 November at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.  

Date: 7 November 2023
item.excerpt:encoded: A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 3 October 2023

item.title: Draft Minutes of the Annual Parish Meeting, 25 April 2023
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL DRAFT MINUTES OF THE PARISH COUNCIL MEETING 25 APRIL 2023

The Annual Parish Meeting was held in West Burton Village Hall on Tuesday, 25 April 2023 at 7.30 pm.

Members of the Council present were: Councillors Jane Ritchie, Chairman, Councillors David Dent, Sally Sahin and Victoria Whitehead, and Mrs Sue Ryding, Clerk Also present: Fifteen residents of the Parish, and Mrs Julie Greenslade, the speaker. The Chairman welcomed everyone and thanked them for attending. 1. Minutes of the last meeting and matters arising The minutes of the last Annual Parish Meeting held on 3 May 2022, having been circulated via the website prior to the meeting, were taken as read. Mr Michael Swan proposed and Mr Tony Rossiter seconded that the minutes were a true record, and this was confirmed by all present. The Chairman commented on various actions that had been taken arising from the minutes of the last meeting. In particular, following on from last year, the Chairman asked again for people who lived alone to leave a key with a neighbour, together with details of someone who could be contacted in case of an emergency. 2. Annual Report, Parish Accounts and points arising There were no questions or comments on the Annual Report, but the Clerk, as the Responsible Financial Officer, answered a query about the Council accounts. The Chairman thanked Mr Neil Smeeton for looking after the defibrillator, having taken over from Mr Peter Willerton last year. 3. Coronation celebration The Chairman outlined the details for the Celebration Lunch on Sunday, 7 May 2023, which would take the form of a bring-and-share lunch. She also told the meeting that the Council would be ordering 25 commemorative 5.00 coins, to be presented to each child in the Parish of the age of 16 or under. In addition a commemorative bench would be ordered, which would be placed at the top of the Green near the Platinum Jubilee bench. She thanked Mr Tony Ellender and Mr Michael Swan for their efforts in putting up the bunting, and reported that more bunting had been ordered for the area at the top of the Green. 4. Talk by Mrs Julie Greenslade Mrs Greenslade gave a very interesting and informative talk to the meeting on her work with Good Life Project, a community support organisation that had started during the pandemic and had continued. Based in Hawes and Leyburn, this support took many forms to help people of all ages who were in need. In particular she was pleased to announce the purchase of the Little White Car, driven by volunteers, which could help people who would otherwise have difficulty getting to medical appointments. Mrs Greenslade was thanked by the Chairman for coming to talk to the meeting about this important project, and Mrs Greenslade kindly offered to send further information on the project that could be distributed around the Parish. The Chairman asked that the Parish Council be kept informed of developments and information. 5. Any other business There were no other matters raised. There being no further business the meeting closed at 8.05 pm.  

Chairman:

Date:
item.excerpt:encoded: Draft Minutes of the Annual Parish Meeting, 25 April 2023

item.title: Annual Report 2023-24
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL ANNUAL REPORT 2023-2024

The Council Jane Ritchie, Chairman David Dent, Councillor Andrew Landau, Councillor Sally Sahin, Councillor Victoria Whitehead, Councillor Sue Ryding, Clerk

Chairman's Introduction In addition to the matters mentioned below, the Council has been involved in various activities, including supporting the Fundraising Group which is now led by Gordon Lunt, Vicky Whitehead, Neil Smeaton and Emma Davis. We have also been pressing the Joint Management Committee for Aysgarth Cemetery to pay for the upkeep of the cemetery instead of relying on volunteers. Following an attempted break-in which damaged the Council's archive cupboard in the Village Hall, a new, more robust fireproof cupboard has been purchased and installed. A notice will be placed on the door of the cupboard pointing out that any funds owned by the Council are not kept inside but in a distant Barclays Bank!

Jane Ritchie, Chairman

  The Council has had a busy year continuing to catch up with matters which had been put into abeyance during the pandemic, but also getting used to working with the new unitary authority, the North Yorkshire Council. Many systems for reporting faults, raising concerns and getting information have had to be re-configured, both by the Parish Council and the higher authority. It is fair to say that it is still a work in progress, with some systems becoming easier and others more complex. We have continued to adapt to these changes as quickly as we can, and then adapt again when the changes are changed. Committees and meeting
  • Councillors and the Clerk were nominated for the following committees and working groups.
  • Aysgarth Cemetery Committee Councillors Sally Sahin and Victoria Whitehead
  • Upper Dales Health Watch Councillor Jane Ritchie
  • Village Hall Committee Councillor Sally Sahin
  • Emergency Working Group Councillors Andrew Landau and David Dent and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
  • West Burton Charity Councillors Jane Ritchie and Victoria Whitehead (also Mrs Sue Tiplady and Mr Richard Nolan)
  • YLCA Councillor David Dent and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
Planning applications The Council was asked to comment on five planning application during the year. One application related to retrospective remedial measure to dim the lighting at Aysgarth Lodge Holidays, Westholme. The Council continues to be concerned about the amount of light pollution emanating from the holiday complex, and has asked for further clarification. All planning applications are discussed at a full meeting of the Council and anyone who is involved can come along and tell us about their concerns or ask for an application to be supported. Any valid objections to, or support for, an application can then be passed on to the Planning Authority. As has been explained in previous years, the Council only has the right to comment. It has no powers to grant or refuse any application. Upkeep and maintenance
  • Street lights. The reporting of street lights that are not working has been problematic, but the system of reporting has now been resolved, and most lights are now relit relatively quickly.
  • Play area. North Yorkshire Council now carries out inspection of the play area on our behalf. We are investigating the cost of a new safety surface under the swings as the existing surface is now in need of replacement.
  • Village Green. As in past years, we would like to thank our Parish Caretaker, Richard Chapman, for his efforts in keeping our Village Green, and many other areas of the village, looking good.
  • Water leak by the Chapel. After nearly two years of investigation, and having denied any responsibility, Yorkshire Water finally located the cause of the persistent leak that emerged in front of the Chapel. It was traced to a broken join in a pipe under the front doorstep of the Clerk's house.
  • Removal of ivy. The Council arranged for the ivy on the trees by the B6160 to be removed.
  • Village sign. Work will begin shortly on restoring the damaged village sign on the B6160
Yorkshire Dales Authority Local Plan A sixth consultation meeting was held at the end of April 2023. The focus was on where development will be allowed to take place within village boundaries. As with the other consultations, the Council responded through the Wensleydale and Coverdale Parish Council Forum, chaired by County Councillor Yvonne Peacock. We understand that the draft Local Plan will be available for consultation shortly. Village events The Coronation event was one of the highlights of the year, marked by the Council with the purchase of a Coronation bench which is now in place on the Village Green. The Council has also taken up the offer of a free portrait of His Majesty King Charles which should arrive shortly. Another welcome event to return this year was the May Fair which raised the astonishing amount of over 7,000. This sum, together with other funds raised previously, has been distributed between the three Parish organisations the Village Hall, the Methodist Chapel and the Parish Council. In total, each organisation has received 2,438.00. The Council would like to thank the many people involved for their tremendous efforts in organising the wonderful May Fair and other fundraising events. Our wonderful fireworks display and bonfire in November, and our traditional mince pies and punch get-together when we light up the Christmas tree in December are now firm favourites in our calendar of events. We are again very grateful to the volunteers who organise and run these events, particularly Peter Wheeler and his team for their tremendous efforts in organising Bonfire Night, David Dent and his helpers for our lovely colourful Christmas tree, and Andy Landau at the Fox and Hounds Inn for the refreshments for both events. As always, we are very grateful to the owner of The Black Bull for allowing us to use their electricity to light up the Christmas tree. The efforts of all these people are very much appreciated. Consultations In addition to the consultation on the Local Plan, the Council has been consulted on the Government's plans for legislation on holiday lets, by the Walden Common Committee on proposed works, and by North Yorkshire Council on the provision of bus services and the organisation of the disposal of household waste. Winter gritting The Council Chairman and the Clerk recently attended a North Yorkshire Council highways seminar at which several matters were raised including winter gritting. Concern was expressed at how long it had taken to get the roads cleared and gritted this year compared to previous years. Several options were discussed with the Highways Department including being allowed to finance our own gritting. Further details of this will be on the agenda for the Annual Parish Meeting which will be held on 23 April in the Village Hall. Finances Our finances remain sufficiently secure to allow us, once again, to maintain the Precept at 6,600. The above mentioned sum of 2,438 received from village fundraising will be put towards the upkeep of the Parish. A summary of the accounts up to the end of the financial

item.title: Parish Council Meeting to be held on 7 May 2024
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 7 May 2024 at 8.00 pm.

Members of the public are invited to address the Council between 8.00 pm and 8.15 pm at the discretion of the Council.

AGENDA
  1. To elect a Chairman for the forthcoming year and to complete and sign the Declaration of Acceptance of Office
  2. To receive apologies for absence.
  3. To receive declarations of interest and to carry out a review of the Member's Code of Conduct and any alterations to the Register of Interests.
  4. To confirm the minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 2 April 2024.
  5. To receive a report from the Clerk on the following matters:
    • Plinth on the B6160
    • Protection of the River Ure
    • Interpretation Board by the Waterfall
    • Council finances.
  6. To consider the nomination of Councillors to Committees, working groups and other organisations.
  7. To confirm the Trustees of West Burton Charity.
  8. To consider the nomination of two Councillors to scrutinise internal aspects of the Council's finances.
  9. To complete the Annual Governance and Accountability Return for 2024 including the Certificate of Exemption and Internal Audit report if available.
  10. To consider matters arising from the Annual Parish Meeting on 23 April 2024.
  11. To consider Planning Application R/54/135E for extensive infrastructure at Little Cote Caravan Park, South Walden.
  12. To consider further solutions to winter gritting.
  13. To consider further the renewal of the play area safety surface.
  14. To consider further the appointment of an Assistant Clerk.
  15. To consider the issue of vehicles parking on pavements in the Village.
  16. To consider the layout of a sign by the Waterfall
  17. To receive the following invoices for payment:
    • Parish Caretaker to be confirmed.
    • Eye-catching Signs - 90.00 (VAT 15.00)
  18. To receive notice of meetings and other events.
  19. To consider items for the next agenda.
  S D Ryding Clerk to the Council

Date: 1 May 2024

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 4th June 2024
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL MINUTES OF THE PARISH COUNCIL MEETING HELD ON TUESDAY, 4 June 2024

A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 4 June 2024

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, Mr David Dent and Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk, and Mr Richard Nolan, Assistant Clerk. Also present: PCSO Sharon Diamond and Mr Neil Smeeton. At the beginning of the meeting, Mr Neil Smeeton reported to the Council on his attendance at a recent meeting of a group set up to protect the River Ure. In particular he outline the problems with the overflows into the Bishopdale Beck from the West Burton sewage treatment plant, which are the worst in the area and have caused the Beck to be down-graded by the Environment Agency from Good' to Moderate'. Councillors discussed possible action that could be taken to rectify this situation, and asked that this matter should be brought forward to the next meeting. Mr Smeeton was thanked for his report. PCSO Sharon Diamond reported that the police would be on hand in West Burton on the next weekend with good weather to assess the parking situation, and to ask visitors to park considerately, and not on the Village Green. 1. Apologies There were no apologies, all the Councillors being present. 2. Declarations of interest There were no declarations of interest 3. Minutes The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 7 May 2024, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman. 4. Clerk's Report The Clerk reported on the following matters: - Waterfall area - Repairs - Council finances RESOLVED: That the Clerk would continue to monitor the situation to ensure that the leak outside the Chapel had stopped. 5. Winter Gritting The Chairman reported that she was still waiting to hear back from Mr Edward Dent. RESOLVED: That this matter should be brought forward for the meeting in September. 6. Renewal of the play area surfaces The Clerk reported that she had submitted an application for a grant for 3,940 from the UK Shared Prosperity Fund/North Yorkshire Council. This represented 80% of the total cost of replacing the play area safety surface under the swings which is 4,925. This sum was a quote received from Rainbow Safety Surfacing Ltd based at Barnoldswick near Skipton, a company recommended by Councillor Victoria Whitehead following her research into costs. The Clerk also reported that Councillor Yvonne Peacock had very kindly confirmed that the sum of 500 would be made available from the Locality Fund, which left a shortfall of 485 that could be met from existing Parish Council funds. The Clerk reported that she had received confirmation that the application had been accepted by UKSPF/NYC and that the decision of the appraisal team would be known in mid to late June. RESOLVED: That the Council will await the decision of the appraisal team. 7. Management of the payroll The Clerk reported that she and the Assistant Clerk had attended an appointment with Yorkshire Dales Accountancy in Hawes, and handed over all the information needed for that firm to manage the Council's payroll. Confirmation of the change-over had been received from HMRC and from the Pensions Regulator. Arrangements now needed to be made with Barclays Bank to make on-line PAYE payments to HMRC by 19 July. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should arrange an appointment with Barclays Bank for herself, the Assistant Clerk and the Chairman in order to set up on-line banking for the Parish Council 8. Review of Standing Orders and Financial Regulations The Clerk reported that there were no outstanding amendments needed for Standing Orders. Councillors then considered a draft of the new 2024 Financial Regulations which had been circulated to Councillors before the meeting. RESOLVED: That, following several amendments, the new version of the Financial Regulations are accepted and approved. 9. Parish Council notice board Following the deterioration of the existing notice board, Councillors considered various option for a new notice board made from man-made timber, which could be re-sited to the other side of the Smithy. The Clerk tabled details of various options costing in the region of 500. RESOLVED: That the Council will postpone a decision on this matter until after the outcome of the grant application for the safety surface under the swings is known. 10. Invoices Cheques in payment of the following invoices were signed: Eyecatching Signs - 21.60 (VAT 3.60) Parish Caretaker - 310.01 11. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended. 12. Items for the next agenda RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following items should be brought forward:
  • Internal audit report
  • Parish Caretaker hourly rate
There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.35 pm Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 2 July 2024 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.  

Chairman: Jane O Ritchie

Date: 2 July 2024
item.excerpt:encoded: A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 4 June 2024

item.excerpt:encoded: A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on 3 December 2024 at 8.00 pm.

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 3 December 2024
item.dc:creator: wbpc-administrator
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 3 December 2024 Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Andrew Landau, Mr David Dent, Mrs Sally Sahin and Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk and Mr Richard Nolan, Assistant Clerk. Also present: County Councillor Yvonne Peacock
  1. Apologies. There were no apologies, all the members being present.

  2. Declarations of interest. There were no declarations of interest.

  3. Minutes The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 5 November 2024, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

  4. Clerk's Report The Clerk reported on the following matters:
    • Email from Yorkshire Water
    • Solar streetlights
    • Donation from May Fair funds
    • Community Anchor Organisation
    • Consultation on cemeteries
    • Council finances
    RESOLVED: That information on the Council's Emergency Plan, and other measures taken to deal with emergencies, should be forwarded to North Yorkshire Council.

  5. Precept The Clerk reported that the form for the Precept for 7,800.00 had been sent to North Yorkshire Council. RESOLVED: That the rise in the Precept should be reported in the January Newsletter.

  6. Calendar of meetings The Council discussed the proposed calendar of meetings that had been circulated to Members earlier. RESOLVED: That the proposed dates are approved and should now be sent to the bookings officer of the Village Hall, and, at her request, to PCSO Sharon Diamond.

  7. Risk assessments Councillors considered the financial and other risk assessment and the Parish Caretaker's risk assessment which had been circulated earlier. RESOLVED: That the risk assessments are accepted and approved, and that the insurance arrangements should remain as they are now.

  8. Land by Flanders Hall The Council considered correspondence received from the owners of Flanders Hall. It was noted that the delay in resolving the issue for many years had been at the request of the owners of Flanders Hall and not at the request of the Council. Councillors also noted that the suggestion of a meeting with the Council's legal adviser to help resolve the issue, had been accepted by the owners. RESOLVED: That a letter should be sent to the owners to suggest a meeting with the Council's legal adviser and clarifying the situation as far as the Council was concerned.

  9. Request for support for tree planting The Chairman reported that she had received an email from Mr Steven Kemp asking for a letter of support for the planting of trees and hedgerows in a field in the Parish. This support had been requested by the Yorkshire Dales Millennium Trust. The Chairman had replied that more details of the extent of the planting and the exact location would be needed before the Parish Council could consider supporting it. This had not yet been received. RESOLVED: That the Chairman would contact Mr Kemp by email to ask him for further information on the proposed planting.

  10. Items for the January Newsletter The Council considered items that should be included in the January Newsletter. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should note these suggestions and include them accordingly.

  11. Invoices There were no invoices which were due payment.

  12. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting and events attended Councillors received reports from meetings attended and noted the dates of forthcoming meetings and events.

  13. Items for the next agenda RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following items should be brought forward to the next agenda.
    • A request to put tables and chairs on the Green.
    • Proposed letter to the ICB regarding funding for the GP practice.
    • Further consideration for items for the next Newsletter.
There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.00pm. Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 7 January 2025 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: Jane O Ritchie Date: 7 January 2025
item.excerpt:encoded: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 3 December 2024

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 7th December 2021
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 7th December 2021

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Ms Beth Daley, Mr Rowland Dent, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk

1. Apologies
There were no apologies, all the members being present

2. Declarations of interest
There were no declarations of interest.

3. Minutes
The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 2 November 2021, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman

4. Clerk's Report
The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Arrangements for the Christmas Event
  • Urban grass cutting
  • Plinths at the entrance to the village
  • Work at the Mill

5. Street lighting
Councillor Rowland Dent gave a very comprehensive report on his investigation into the feasibility of installing a street light at the junction between the Front and Back Nooks, and his correspondence and phone calls with personnel from Richmondshire District Council. He had also been in touch with a representative of Northern Powergrid regarding the possibility of an electricity supply to a street light in that location.

RESOLVED: That Councillor Dent has kindly agreed to pursue the matter further with Northern Powergrid and arrange a site meeting, if possible before Christmas, but otherwise early in the New Year, and to report back to the Council at the next meeting.

6. New Code of Conduct
Councillors reported that they had had difficulty downloading or printing the new Code of Conduct that had been taken from the YLCA website and circulated before the meeting. There were also doubts about whether or not this copy was up to date.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should investigate further and obtain an up to date copy that could be downloaded, and bring this matter back to the Council at the next meeting.

7. Burial grounds
The Clerk reported that she had received an email from the Clerk to Aysgarth and District Parish Council which reported that Councillors there were in the process of arranging a meeting of the Cemetery Committee to consider the issues raised in the White Rose weekly bulletin of 5 November 2021 regarding burial grounds.

RESOLVED: That the Council would wait to hear further from Aysgarth and District Parish Council.

8. Calendar of meeting dates for 2022
Councillors considered the suggested dates for meetings in 2022, and noted that a Parish Council election would be held on 5 May 2022.

RESOLVED: That the suggested dates are approved

9. Risk assessment
The Council reviewed the Risk Assessment prior to the renewal in the New Year of the Council's insurance.

RESOLVED: That with one amendment to the arrangements regarding Bonfire Night, the Risk Assessment is approved

10. Invoices
A cheque for the following invoice was signed.

  • Parish Caretaker - 781.00

11. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended
Councillors noted the dates of future meetings, and received reports on meetings attended.

12. Items for the next agenda
RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following item should be brought forward for the next agenda:

  • The situation regarding notification of planning applications

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.30 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 4th January 2022 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 1 February 2022

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 1st February 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 1 February 2022

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Ms Beth Daley, Mr Rowland Dent, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

1. Apologies
There were no apologies, all the members being present.

2. Declarations of interest
There were no declarations of interest.

3. Minutes
The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 7 December 2021, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

4. Clerk's Report
The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Christmas tree
  • Planning application notifications
  • Council finances

Street lighting
Councillor Rowland Dent reported to the Members that he had written to Richmondshire District Council and was hoping to arrange a visit to discuss the installation of a new street light between the Front and Back Nooks. He also reported that he had investigated the cost of installing a street light which he estimated was in the region of 1,500 - 2,000.

RESOLVED: That the Council would await a reply from Richmondshire District Council and a further report from Councillor Dent.

5. New Code of Conduct
Councillors considered the new Code of Conduct which had been amended and forwarded to the Members before the meeting.

RESOLVED: That the new Code of Conduct should be approved and adopted in full, but the Clerk should make enquiries as to who the Monitoring Officer would be when Richmondshire District Council was disbanded in May 2022.

6. Council insurance premium
The Council considered a quote from Zurich Municipal for 462.11 as the premium for the Council's insurance cover.

RESOLVED: That the premium is agreed and that a cheque for 462.11 should be duly signed.

7. Internal auditor
Councillors considered the appointment of an internal auditor.

RESOLVED: That Mrs Pauline Beckett should be asked if she would again carry out the Council's internal audit.

8. Best Kept Village Competition
Councillors considered entering the village in the Best Kept Village Competition should it be held in the summer.

RESOLVED: That the village should be entered, if invited, and that the Clerk should put an item to this effect in the April newsletter

9. Review of the Clerk's salary and hours
The Clerk reported that at present there was no information on pay rates for Clerks as negotiations with the government were ongoing.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk's salary and hours should remain unchanged until further information was received.

10. Plinths at the entrance to the village
Councillors considered a revised design produced by Mr John Miller for the plinth, which used two gate posts with the West Burton sign fixed to them. Various amendments to this design were considered.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should discuss the changes with Mr Miller, but that the design was approved in principle, and that the first plinth should be completed before considering the plinth on the Bishopdale Road

11. Work on the sewage system of the Mill
Councillors considered a request from the owner of one of the flats in the Mill, to re-site the Mill's sewage system on the land next to the Mill which is owned by the Parish Council. The owner had also provided information on the dimensions of the system and plans showing where exactly it would be sited.

RESOLVED: That the Council gives permission for the system to be installed as shown on the plans, but that the owner must be asked to consult a solicitor to provide the necessary documentation for an easement, for the system to be sited on Parish Council land.


12. Emails on various matters received from a resident of the Parish
The Council considered several emails on a variety of matters that had been received from a Parish resident. All the matters were discussed in detail.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should reply to the resident with the Council's view on the various issues raised

13. Invoices
There were no outstanding invoices for payment

14. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended
Councillors noted the dates of future meetings.

15. Items for the next agenda
RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following item should be brought forward for the next agenda:

  • Consideration of the purchase of a bench to commemoration HM the Queen's Platinum Jubilee and the purchase of a new flag for West Burton Primary School

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.45 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 1st March 2022 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 3 March 2022

item.title: Annual Parish Council Meeting to be held on 3rd May 2022

The Annual Parish Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 3rd May 2022 at 7.30 pm n the Village hall.

All members of the parish are welcome to attend.

AGENDA
  1. Minutes of the last meeting, held on 7 May 2019, and matters arising

item.excerpt:encoded: A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 3rd May 2022 at 7.30 pm

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 3rd March 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Thursday, 3 March 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Rowland Dent, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

1. Apologies
There were no apologies, all the members being present.

2. Declarations of interest
Apologies were received and the reason accepted from Councillor Beth Daley.

3. Minutes
The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 1 February 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

4. Clerk's Report
The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Internal audit
  • Flag for West Burton School
  • Visitor car parking
  • Drains on Dame Lane
  • Benches
  • Water leak on Dame Lane
  • Progress on setting up on-line banking

5. Motor mower insurance cover
Councillors considered an invoice for 159.41 from NFU Mutual for the insurance premium for the motor mower.

RESOLVED: That the insurance should be renewed and that a cheque for 159.41 should be duly signed

6. B122 notices from the Land Registry
The Council considered two B122 notices of application for first registration for 12.75 acres of land next to Chapel Green, Walden, and Crook Pasture, Walden.

RESOLVED: That the Council has no objection to make to these registrations

7. Schedule of Assets
Councillors considered the Schedule of Assets which had been circulated before the meeting. The Clerk reported that she had done an audit of benches in the Parish and had reduced the
number of benches from 25 to 23.

RESOLVED: That the Schedule of Assets in accepted and should be duly signed by the Chairman and the Clerk.

8. Street lighting
Councillor Dent reported that he had made some progress with the possibility of installing a light above the footpath between the Front and Back Nooks. Through consultation with Mr Gary Hudson of Richmondshire District Council and with Northern Powergrid he had ascertained that it could be possible to install an LED light at an estimated cost of 2,000.

RESOLVED: That Councillor Dent is thanked for his efforts and that the Council should await further information.

9. Platinum Jubilee
Councillors considered an offer of funding from Richmondshire District Council, possibly to put towards a bench to mark HM The Queen's Platinum Jubilee. The Clerk reported that the Council already had sufficient funds available in the current account if it was the Council's wish to purchase a commemorative bench.

RESOLVED: That there was no requirement at this stage to apply for extra funding, and that the Clerk should obtain a quote for a suitable bench and commemorative plaque.

10. Information Commissioner's Office fee
Councillors considered a reminder from the Information Commissioner's Office that a fee of 40.00 under GDPR regulations was due.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should arrange the payment of this amount.

11. Plinths at the entrance to West Burton
The Council considered a further revision to the design of the plinth that involved building a small wall between the two gate posts on which the West Burton sign could be fixed. The Clerk reported that she had spoken to Mr John Miller who had said that he could carry out the work.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should ask Mr Miller to undertake the work as soon as he was able.

12. Gate at the entrance to the Reading Room path
Councillors considered a report from the owner of Rowan House Farm that the gate at the entrance to the Reading Room path was in poor condition. The Chairman reported that she had been in touch with the previous owner of the Reading Room to ask him if he knew why the gate had been placed across the entrance to a public right of way in the first place. After consideration it was established that there was no longer a valid reason why the gate across the path should remain.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should ask the Parish Caretaker to remove the gate and dispose of it and that she should notify the owner of Rowan House Farm accordingly.

13. Work at the Mill
The Council received an update from Mrs Juliet Maddan on work that her son, Mr Humphrey Maddan, wished to undertaken at the Mill, which would involve renewing and re-siting the sewage pumping tank on land adjacent to the Mill owned by the Council. Mrs Madden reported that she had consulted the Planning Authority of the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority and been informed that planning permission would be required. She also reported that she was obtaining quotes from three different suppliers and, having decided on who should do the work, would be submitting a planning application as soon as possible. She also confirmed that she would consult her solicitor with regard to obtaining a Deed of Grant of Easement for permission to site the tank on Council land.

RESOLVED: That Mrs Maddan is thanked for attending the meeting and for this information, and that the Council will await the notification of the planning application in due course.

14. Correspondence regarding the track past Hartle's Butchers
Councillors considered an email received from the owners of Sunny Side regarding vehicles speeding on the track that runs past their house. The Council was asked to consider closing the road to through traffic or installing road bumps near to their property. However, the Council agreed it did not have the power to close the road and that this would, in any case, adversely affect all the residents in the area as well as Hartle's Butchers. It was also felt that the surface of the track was sufficient uneven that most vehicles were driven cautiously.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should respond to the email that the Council did not feel that any action should be taken at this stage.

15. Date of the Annual Parish Meeting
Councillors considered moving the date of the Annual Parish Meeting from Tuesday, 26 April to Tuesday, 3 May as the Clerk will be away from home on 26 April.

RESOLVED: That the date of the Annual Parish Meeting should be changed to Tuesday, 3 May and that the Clerk should ensure that the main hall of the Village Hall is available on that date.

16. Invoices
A cheque for the following payment was signed:

  • D Hartle repair of the track past Hartle's Butchers - 120.00

17. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended
Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and received reports of meetings attended.

18. Items for the next agenda
RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following item should be brought forward for the next agenda:

  • Planning application R/54/7X at Aysgarth Lodge Holidays for the siting of 17 glamping pods and assorted works.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.00 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 5 April 2022 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 5 April 2022

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 5th July 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 5 July 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, and Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

Also present: Councillor Yvonne Peacock of North Yorkshire County Council.

1. Apologies
There were no apologies, all the members being present.

2. Declarations of interest
There were no declarations of interest.

3. Minutes
The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 7 June 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

4. Clerk's Report
The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Track by the Butcher's Shop.
  • Cherry tree on the Green.
  • Traffic survey cameras.
  • Welcome pack delivered
  • Finances.

5. Street light
The Clerk reported that she had not received any further information on the matter of the installation of a street light between the Front and Back Nooks.

RESOLVED: That this matter should be brought forward to the next meeting.

6. Planning application R/54/7X for Aysgarth Lodge Holidays
The Council considered a revised planning application for 6 glamping pods at Aysgarth Lodge Holidays at Westholme Bank. The Clerk also reported that she had had a conversation with Mr Ian Faircloth, the Enforcement Officer, regarding this matter and previous concerns about the expansion of this holiday site.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should respond that the Council welcomed that fact that the number of glamping pods had been much reduced, but that other concerns previously expressed still applied.

7.Local Plan Consultation No 5 Preferred Options'
Councillors considered the proposals set out in the document produced by the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority and discussed the various options with Councillor Yvonne Peacock. It was noted that a meeting of the Parish Forum was scheduled for 10 August 2022, at the Corn Mill Tea Rooms in Bainbridge.

RESOLVED: That members of the Council would attend the meeting on 10 August and would then contribute to the joint Parish Forum response to this consultation.

8. Email received from a visitor to West Burton Falls
Councillors noted the contents of this email in which a visitor commented on the state of the access road to the Waterfall. It was alleged that the roughness of the road made access for disabled people impossible.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should reply that access to the Waterfall was available by car and that once in the car park, the ground was relatively flat. Also, the Waterfall was a conservation area and was intended to be as natural as possible.

9. Parish Caretaker's terms of employment
Councillors considered a request from the Parish Caretaker for an increase in the hourly rate paid by the Council, which at present is 10.

RESOLVED: That the hourly rate should be increased to 13, and that this should be reviewed on a yearly basis.

10. Report on the Resilience and Community Planning Webinar course
The Clerk reported on her attendance at this webinar course on 9 June which mostly focussed on the need for an emergency plan to be in place in each parish. Councillors noted that an Emergency Plan had been in place in this Parish since 2007, but was in need of updating.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk and Councillor David Dent would work on an updated version of the existing Plan, and that the Village Hall Committee should be consulted on a proposal to purchase a generator that would be able to provide heat and light to the Village Hall in the event of a prolonged power cut, so that this building could be used as an emergency centre.

11. Invoices
Cheques for the following invoices were signed:

  • Clerk's salary - 605.05
  • PAYE - 151.20
  • Parish Caretaker - 283.78 (VAT 6.46)
  • Village shop (handing baskets) - 56.00
  • Simon Winstanley (mower repairs) - 188.59 (VAT 31.43)
  • YLCA (course fee) - 16.70
  • Yoredale Computer Services - 180.00 (VAT 30.00)
  • J W Alderson & Sons - 118.03 (VAT 19.67)

12. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended
Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended.

13. Items for the next agenda
RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following matters should be brought forward to the next meeting:

  • Parking and cones in the Village

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.30 pm.

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 6 September 2022 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 6 September 2022

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 7th June 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 7 June 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, and Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

1. Apologies
There were no apologies, all the members being present.

2. Declarations of interest
There were no declarations of interest

3. Minutes
The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 10 May 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

4. Clerk's Report
The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Documents relating to the Election
  • Jubilee Bench
  • Annual Governance and Accountability Return
  • Website

5. Trustees of West Burton Charity
The Council considered nominations for trustees for the West Burton Charity.

RESOLVED: That Councillor Victoria Whitehead is confirmed as a trustee for the West Burton Charity.

6. Track by the Butcher's Shop
The Clerk reported that Mr Peter Iveson had inspected the track and had recommended that the best way to clear the larger loose stones would be to rake them off manually. Councillors then considered that suggestion and other options.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should ask the Parish Caretaker if he could undertake clearing the larger stones from the track.

7. Cherry tree on the Village Green
The Clerk reported that Mr David Allan of the Wensleydale Horticultural Services had inspected the tree and recommended that the lower branches should be removed for safety reasons. The work would cost in the region of 250. Mr Allan also would undertake getting the necessary permission for the work from the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should ask Mr Allan to go ahead with the work.

8. Street light
The Clerk reported that she had not received any further information on the matter of the installation of a street light between the Front and Back Nooks.

RESOLVED: That this matter should be brought forward to the next meeting.

9. Traffic surveys in West Burton
The Clerk reported that she had been in contact with Mr Alan Palfreyman of North Yorkshire County Council regarding the positioning of traffic surveys in West Burton. He had explained that the traffic detectors were authorised by the Department of Transport, but that the County Council Highways Department were notified when the surveys would take place. He agreed to ask the Highways Department to notify the Parish Council when this would happen again.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk would contact the Highways Department to confirm that the Council should be notified, and would place an item in the next newsletter explaining the purpose of the surveys, the duration and when they would be likely to occur.

10. Review of Standing Orders and Financial Regulations
Councillors considered whether there were any amendments required for Standing Orders and Financial Regulations.

RESOLVED: That there were no amendments required for Standing Orders, and that amendments to Financial Regulations should wait until the Council was able to make direct electronic payments of invoices.

11. Invoices
A cheque for the following payment was signed:

  • Postage and stamps - 36.05
  • J W Alderson & Sons - 73.04 (VAT 12.17)

12. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended
Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and received reports of meetings attended.

13. Items for the next agenda
RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following item should be brought forward for the next agenda:

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.30 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 5 July at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 10 May 2022

item.title: Minutes of the Annual Parish Meeting - 3rd May 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL
MINUTES OF THE ANNUAL PARISH MEETING 3 MAY 2022

The Annual Parish Meeting was held in West Burton Village Hall on Tuesday, 3 May 2022 at 7.30 pm.

Members of the Council present were: Councillors Jane Ritchie, Chairman, Councillors Andrew Landau and Sally Sahin, and Mrs Sue Ryding, Clerk.

Also present: Fourteen members of the public. The Chairman welcomed everyone after the long absence, and thanked them for attending.

1. Minutes of the last meeting and matters arising

The Minutes of the last Annual Parish Meeting held on 7 May 2019, having been circulated prior to the meeting, were taken as read. Mr Keith Ryding proposed and Mr Tony Rossiter seconded that the Minutes were a true record, and this was confirmed by all present.

There were no matters arising.

2. Annual Report, Parish Accounts and points arising

There were no questions or comments on the Annual Report, but the Clerk, as the Responsible Financial Officer, answered some queries about the Council accounts.
The Chairman announced that in addition to the information in the Annual Report, she could confirm that a Platinum Jubilee commemoration bench had been ordered and should be delivered soon. This would be put in place at the top of the Village Green.
The Chairman thanked retiring Councillor Beth Daley, particularly for the many instances when she had assisted with the Council's IT matters, and Councillor Rowland Dent who had given many years of service to the community. She also announced that following the 5 May, the Council would have its full five members with the election of new Councillors Vicky Whitehead and David Dent.
The Chairman also thanked Mr Peter Willerton for his diligence in looking after the defibrillator for many years, and welcomed Mr Neil Smeeton, who had kindly agreed to take over this task.

3. Platinum Jubilee celebration

The Chairman then outlined the arrangements already in place for the Hog Roast on Sunday, 5 June, and asked for further suggestions for the day, and any offers of assistance. This was duly discussed at length. The Chairman then thanked everyone for their contributions and offers to help with putting up bunting and two marquees, preparations beforehand and after the event, assistance with the egg throwing contest and with the water-slide. The Clerk was asked to put all this information and contact details into a newsletter which, together with a poster, would be circulated as soon as possible.

4. Any other business

The Chairman mentioned a few other matters, the first of which was the intention of the Parish Council to ask for people who lived alone if they could please leave details of someone to be contacted in case of emergency. More on this would be forthcoming soon.

She also asked for suggestions for items for the welcome packs that are provided for residents moving into the Parish.

Finally, she asked if anyone would like to assist her in cataloguing the archive of documents she had inherited.

Mrs Edna Rossiter asked the Council to consider creating a wild flower area on part of the Village Green, or in other areas such as the Waterfall. The Chairman said that this would certainly be discussed at the next Council meeting.

Mr Tony Ellender raised the issue of the unsatisfactory state of the road passed the Butcher's shop. The Chairman confirmed that this too would be discussed at the next Council meeting

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.35 pm

Chairman:

Date:
