item.title: Minutes - 9th September 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 6 September 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk

Also present: The owner of Little Cote who wished to address the Council with regard to Item 9

  1. Apologies

Apologies were received from Councillor Victoria Whitehead, and the reason for the apologies were accepted.

  1. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest.

  1. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 5 July 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

  1. Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

    • Cherry tree on the Green
    • Council Website
    • Consultation No. 5 on the Local Plan
    • Finances
  1. Review of rental charges

The rental for the three properties owned by the Parish Council, namely Stoney Wood, Morpeth Scar and Hudson's Quarry were reviewed.

RESOLVED: That the rents should remain the same at 10, 5 and 5 respectively

  1. Arrangements for Bonfire Night

The Clerk reported that she had contact Mr Peter Wheeler, who had kindly agreed to organise the Bonfire Night event again, including the purchase of the fireworks. All other arrangements would be the same as in previous years.

RESOLVED: That the event should take place on Saturday, 5 November, and that the usual notice and request for helpers should be included in the Newsletter.

  1. Arrangements for Christmas

Councillors reviewed the arrangements for ordering and putting up the Christmas tree and the subsequent lighting up event.

RESOLVED: That the tree should be ordered in time for Saturday, 10 December, that Councillor David Dent has kindly agreed to put it up and decorate it, and that the lighting up event, with punch and mince pies in the Fox and Hounds Inn should take place on Sunday, 11 December at 5.00 pm. The Clerk also would contact the owner of the Black Bull to ask for permission to use their electricity to power the lights, with the same arrangement as last year, including the donations to the Yorkshire and Great North Air Ambulances.

  1. Revised Emergency Plan

Councillors reviewed the draft Emergency Plan, including considering nominations for the Community Emergency Team, investigating the cost of a generator for the Village Hall, compiling a list of vulnerable people in the Parish, and a list of community resources to help in an emergency.

RESOLVED: That Councillor David Dent will kindly undertake to review and update the list of community resources, that the Clerk will continue revising other sections of the Emergency Plan and that this will be considered at the next meeting.

  1. Planning applications

Councillors considered the following planning applications:

    • R/54/37J for the conversion of a coach house and stables to form two holiday apartments at The Grange, West Burton
    • R/54/37KLB for listed building consent for the above conversion at The Grange, West Burton
    • R/54/166 for the erection of a workshop and terrace at Little Cote, West Burton

RESOLVED: That the Council has no objection to make to any of these planning applications.

  1. Information on the Civility and Respect Project

The Council considered information received on this project in particular on the implications of taking the Pledge'.

  1. Request for a ramp at Low Wood House, West Burton

Councillors considered a request for the installation of a ramp at Low Wood House, West Burton to facilitate better access by wheelchair on to the Village Green.

RESOLVED: That the Council should hold a site meeting at Low Wood House to look at the proposed design of a temporary ramp, and that the Clerk should arrange this.

  1. Parking and parking cones around the Village Green

Councillors considered the problem of residents putting out parking cones outside their residences around the Village Green. Whilst the Council understood the difficulties of parking in that area of West Burton, particularly when there were many visitors during weekends, it was felt that this illegal practice should be discouraged.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should put an item in the Newsletter and that, if the problem persists, the Council would consider asking the police to remove the cones.

  1. Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices were signed:

    • W Alderson & Sons - 120.02 (VAT 20.00)
  1. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended.

  1. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there were no other matters for the next agenda.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.50 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 4October 2021 at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

item.title: Minutes - 4th Oct 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 4 October 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

Also present: Councillor Yvonne Peacock of Richmondshire District Council.

  1. Apologies

There were no apologies, all the Councillors being present.

  1. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest.

  1. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 6 September, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

  1. Clerk's Report

The Clerk confirmed that she would report on matters as they arose.

  1. Half-yearly financial review

Councillors considered the half-yearly review of the budget and the bank reconciliation, which had been circulated before the meeting, and received a verbal report from the Responsible Financial Officer. A preliminary setting of the Precept was also considered.

RESOLVED: That the half-yearly budget and the bank reconciliation are accepted and approved and that the preliminary setting of the Precept was that it should remain at 6,600.00.

  1. Arrangements for Bonfire Night

The Clerk reported that she had now received detailed information on the arrangements for Bonfire Night from Mr Peter Wheeler. The fireworks had been ordered and a cheque for 1,129.00.00 from the Burton-cum-Walden Fundraising account had been sent to the Northeast Fireworks Company. The turf would be lifted on 22 October and all other arrangements would be as in other years.

RESOLVED: That the information on the arrangements for this event are duly noted.

  1. Revised Emergency Plan

The Chairman tabled a proposed list of vulnerable people and who would check on them, and Councillor David Dent tabled a revised list of equipment that could be called upon in an emergency. The Clerk confirmed that she had amended all other sections of the Plan and was in the process of contacting the proposed members of the Emergency Team to ask if they would be prepared to participate. Councillors also considered plans to purchase a generator that would provide power to Village Hall lighting and heating in case of a power cut.

RESOLVED: That the Chairman would investigate further together with members of the Village Hall Committee, the cost of a generator, the electrical fixtures required to feed it into the circuit, and how powerful the generator needed to be.

  1. Wensleydale School

Councillors considered a consultation request from Wensleydale School on the proposed temporary closure of 6th Form provision.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should respond that the Council was disappointed that the temporary closure was necessary but understood the reasons why.

  1. Information on the Civility and Respect Project

The Council considered further information received on this project in particular on the implications of taking the Pledge' and the model Dignity at Work policy.

RESOLVED: That Councillors agreed that the existing Code of Conduct was sufficient for the moment, but that the Clerk should circulate a copy of the Nolan Principles for Members information.

  1. Proposal for a dog waste bin by Eshington Bridge

Councillors considered a request from Mrs Christine Pratt for an additional dog waste bin to be sited near Eshington Bridge and Spickles Lane.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should investigate where in the Eshington Lane area Richmondshire District Council waste collection department would be prepared to go to empty a dog waste bin and report back at the next meeting.

  1. Proposed installation of a ramp across the Green by Low Wood House

The Chairman reported on a discussion she had had with Mrs Sue Enwright, the daughter of Mrs Chapman, the occupier of Low Wood House. The Chairman had asked Mrs Enwright to ascertain from the Social Services Department of North Yorkshire County Council exactly what was required for a proposed ramp to facilitate access to Low Wood House by a wheelchair.

RESOLVED: That the Council would await the information from the Social Services Department.

  1. Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices were signed:

    • Parish Caretaker - 450.50
    • Clerk's salary - 605.05
    • PAYE - 151.20
    • Viking Office Supplies - 40.74 (VAT 6.79)
    • J W Alderson & Sons - 119.05 (VAT 19.83)
  1. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended.

  1. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED:That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following matters should be brought forward to the next meeting:

    • Preparations for the Coronation of HM King Charles III
    • Traffic issues in West Burton

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.20 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 1 November 2021 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.

item.title: Minutes - 1st Nov 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 1 November 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

  1. Apologies

There were no apologies, all the Councillors being present.

  1. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest.

  1. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 4 October 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman.

  1. Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

    • Arrangements for Bonfire Night
    • Response to the consultation on Wensleydale School
  1. Revised Emergency Plan

The Clerk reported that several people had been contacted to ask if they would be willing to be part of the emergency team, with mixed results. Councillors considered further who could be approached to make up the numbers. The Clerk confirmed that all other amendments to the new Plan had been completed. The Chairman reported on information and costs she had obtained for the right size of generator. She also reported that Richmondshire District Council were offering grants for items like generators, but that any bid had to be in by the end of November. Councillors also considered approaching the Village Hall Committee to ask if it would be willing to become involved in the cost of installing the infrastructure to support a generator. The question of what facilities were required to charge up mobile phones in the event of a power failure was also considered.

RESOLVED:

    • That the Chairman would forward the forms for a grant towards the cost of a generator to the Clerk when they were received so that they could be completed, and that the Chairman would investigate what was needed to charge mobile phones.
    • That the Clerk would contact the proposed members of the emergency team to ask them if they would be willing to join.
    • That Councillor Sally Sahin would liaise with the Village Hall Committee regarding costs.
  1. Proposal for a new dog waste bin near Eshington Bridge

The Clerk reported that she had spoken to Ms Julie Tombs from the waste department at Richmondshire District Council regarding siting a new dog bin at Eshington Bridge. Ms Tombs had informed her that the District Council could investigate where a bin could be sited, and then if that could be agreed, they could purchase it and install it at a cost of 270.00 to the Parish Council.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should ask Richmondshire District Council to go ahead and investigate a suitable site near Eshington Bridge.

  1. Proposed installation of a ramp across the Green by Low Wood House

The Chairman reported that nothing further had been heard from the Social Service Department as yet.

RESOLVED: That the Council would continue to await the information from the Social Services Department.

  1. Plans for the Coronation of HM King Charles III

Councillors considered the purchase of new bunting and a new bench to commemorate the Coronation of HM King Charles which was scheduled to take place on Saturday, 6 May 2023. Councillors also considered whether to hold a hog roast or a celebration bring and share tea.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should investigate the cost of new bunting and a new bench, and that the preferred option for the day was a celebration bring and share tea.

  1. Traffic issues in West Burton

The Clerk reported that she had met with Mr Ian Beighton from the Highways Department of North Yorkshire County Council to consider measures to prevent vehicles driving from the Waterfall area down the Front Nook instead of going round the village. Mr Beighton recommended starting by reinstating the signs painted on the roads around the village. This would start with the one on the junction of the Waterfall road and the road around the Green which indicated vehicle should turn left at this point. Re-painting the signs could take some time, but Mr Beighton agreed to put this on the list for the contractor to undertake.

RESOLVED: That the Council would see if re-instating the signs improved the situation.

  1. Request for a donation to Citizens Advice

The Clerk tabled a letter she had received from Citizens Advice asking for a donation towards their costs. This was discussed by the Councillors.

RESOLVED: That a donation of 50.00 should be send, and that a cheque for this amount should be duly signed.

  1. Review of the policy for recording meetings

Councillors consider the policy for recording meetings which is displayed in the Committee Room of the Village Hall.

RESOLVED: That the policy does not need amendment at this time.

  1. Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices were signed:

    • Mr Martin Dimmock (replacement cheque) - 50.00
    • West Burton Village Hall rental - 15.00
    • Domain renewal - 3.99
    • Defibrillator pads - 140.40 (VAT 23.40)
  1. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended.

  1. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following matters should be brought forward to the next meeting:

    • Further consideration of the Civility and Respect Pledge.
    • Report on the Fundraising meeting due to take place on 24 November.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.15 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 6 December 2021 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.

item.title: Minutes - 6th December 2022
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 6th December 2022.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr David Dent, Mr Andrew Landau, Mrs Sally Sahin, Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk.

  1. Apologies

Apologies were received, and the reason for the absence accepted, from Councillor Victoria Whitehead.

  1. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest.

  1. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 1 November 2022, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman

  1. Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

    • Review of the Emergency Plan.
    • Dog waste bin near Eshington Bridge.
  1. Emergency generator

The Clerk reported that she had completed the grant form ready to be sent to Richmondshire District Council. There was some discussion about the type of generator needed and the consequent cost. The Clerk also reported that she had received a copy of the grant application made by the Village Hall for the cost of the installation of the connection mechanism for the generator.

RESOLVED:

    • That the Chairman and the Clerk should duly sign the grant application form so that it could be submitted
    • That Councillor David Dent would investigate further the type of generator needed.
  1. Preparations for the Coronation celebrations

The Chairman reported that at a recent meeting of the Fundraising Group, it had been decided that a bring-and-share tea would be the preferred option. The precise timing and date is to be confirmed. At the same meeting, there had been a discussion about whether or not there should be a May Fair next year, and if the funds remaining in the fundraising account should be used for that purpose, or should be divided up between the three organisations. A decision will be made at the next meeting of the Fundraising Group in January. In the meantime, Councillors discussed the amount and type of bunting needed, following information received from Mr Tony Ellender.

RESOLVED:

    • That the Clerk would ask Mr Ellender if he would purchase the bunting and then the Council could reimburse him.
    • That the Clerk should provide details of the fundraising account to the treasurer of the Village Hall Committee.
    • That this matter should be brought forward to the next meeting.
  1. Council Precept

A request had been received from Richmondshire District Council for the Parish Council to set the Precept for the year 2023-24.

RESOLVED: That the Precept should be set at 6,600 as had previously been discussed at the October meeting, and that the Precept form should be duly completed and signed by the Clerk.

  1. Financial and other risk assessments

Councillors considered the financial and other risk assessments which had been circulated prior to the meeting.

RESOLVED: That the financial and other risk assessments are approved and accepted and should be duly signed by the Chairman and the Clerk.

  1. Clerk's salary

The Clerk tabled the recommended salary award information received from the National Association of Local Councils and this was considered by the Councillors.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should remain on SCP20 on the scale and that she should receive the recommended increase in salary from 3,025.00 to 3,245.00 per annum to be effective from April 2023.

  1. Calendar of meeting dates for 2023

The Clerk tabled a calendar of proposed dates for meetings in 2023.

RESOLVED: That the calendar is amended and approved and should now be circulated.

  1. Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices were signed:

    • Parish Caretaker - 305.50.
  1. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended.

  1. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, the following matters should be brought forward to the next meeting:

    • Further consideration of the Civility and Respect Pledge.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 9.15 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 10th January 2023 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.

item.title: Minutes - 3rd Mar 2020
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL

MINUTES OF THE ANNUAL PARISH COUNCIL MEETING HELD ON

TUESDAY, 7 JULY 2020

The Annual Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 7 July 2020. This meeting had been scheduled for 5 May 2020 but had been delayed due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Ms Beth Daley, Mr Rowland Dent, Mr Andrew Landau and Mrs Sally Sahin Councillors, and Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk

1. Election of Chairman

Councillor Beth Daley proposed and Councillor Sally Sahin seconded, that Councillor Jane Ritchie should be elected as Chairman, and this was passed unanimously. Councillor Jane Ritchie then signed the Declaration of Acceptance of Office.

2. Risk Assessment for the meeting

A Risk Assessment for the use of the Village Hall for meetings of the Council during the Covid-19 pandemic was considered.

RESOLVED: That the Risk Assessment is approved

3. Apologies

There were no apologies, all the members being present.

4. Declarations of interest

There were no declarations of interest

5. Minutes

The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 3 March 2020, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman

6. Clerk's Report

The Clerk reported on the following matters:

  • Plinths at the entrances to the village
  • Repair of the flat swings
  • Council finances

RESOLVED: That the stone to be used for the new plinths should be the random tumbled'

7. Nomination of Councillors to Committees, Working Groups and other organisations

RESOLVED: That the Council would be represented on committees, groups and other organisations as follows:

  • Aysgarth Cemetery Committee Cllrs Rowland Dent and Sally Sahin
  • Upper Dales Health Watch Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • RDC Upper Dales Area Partnership Board Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • Village Hall Committee Cllr Jane Ritchie
  • Emergency Working Group Cllr Andrew Landau
  • YLCA Cllr Beth Daley and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
  • Fundraising Group Cllrs Jane Ritchie and Sally Sahin and the Clerk, Sue Ryding
  • Rights of Way working group Cllrs Jane Ritchie and Beth Daley and the Clerk, Sue Ryding

8. Trustees of West Burton Charity

The Council considered nominations for trustees for the West Burton Charity

RESOLVED: That Councillor Jane Ritchie and Mrs Gail Dent should remain as trustees

9. Internal scrutiny of the Council's finances

RESOLVED: That Councillors Andrew Landau and Beth Daley are appointed to scrutinise the Council's finances.

10. Internal Audit Report

The Internal Audit Report from Mrs Pauline Beckett was considered, having been circulated before the meeting. The Council also considered an invoice from Mrs Beckett for 20.00

RESOLVED: That the comments are duly noted and that a cheque for 20.00 should be duly signed

11. Annual Return

The Annual Return and accompanying documents were examined following the Internal Audit carried out on 11 June 2020.

RESOLVED: That the Annual Return, and accompanying documents should be accepted and adopted, and that the Annual Return should be completed as follows:

  • Certificate of exemption
  • Section 1 Annual governance statement 2019/20
  • Bank reconciliation as at 31 March 2020
  • Explanation of significant variations for the year ending 31 March 2020
  • Section 2 Accounting statements 2019/20

12. Code of Conduct for Councillors

A consultation request on the draft Model Member Code of Conduct was considered and the survey completed.

RESOLVED: That the completed survey should be forwarded to the National Association of Local Councils

13. Vacancy at Cavey Garth

Councillors considered an email from Sanctuary Housing with details of two bidders for the vacant property at Cavey Garth.

RESOLVED: That Sanctuary Housing should be informed that the Council felt that Ruth Boddy has the stronger local link and is recommended for the vacancy

14. Removal of laybys on the A684

Councillors considered proposals from North Yorkshire County Council for the removal of laybys on the A684 under the Safer Roads Scheme.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should complete and return the survey, with a copy to Councillor Yvonne Peacock, saying that the Council felt there was insufficient information as to exactly which laybys are to be removed, but that most of them should remain, to alleviate parking congestion in other areas. In particularly, the layby near the Aysgarth Surgery should remain, as should the layby alongside the AA Box. However, the Council supported the removal of laybys where access in and out was considered to be a hazard.

15. Safety measures for re-opening the play area on the Village Green

The Council considered the practical measures that could be taken during the Covid-19 pandemic for the safe re-opening of play area. Councillor Beth Daley reported that she had placed temporary safety signage on the equipment pending the meeting.

RESOLVED: That the signage is approved and should remain and that Councillor Daley is thanked for this initiative

16. Complaint about congestion on the Front Nook

Councillors considered a complaint received about vehicles parking on the Front Nook and causing congestion when larger vehicles were trying to get through.

RESOLVED: That the Clerk should contact the owners of the vehicles and ask them to park more considerately

17. Invoices

Cheques for the following invoices had been signed earlier.

  • J W Alderson & Sons - 60.00 (VAT 9.99)
  • West Burton Village Hall - 15.00

18. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended

Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meeting attended.

19. Items for the next agenda

RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there are no additional items that should be brought forward to the next agenda. Councillors also resolved that the next meeting should be held on 6 October unless circumstances required another meeting sooner.

There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.50 pm

Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 6 October at 7.30 pm in the Village Hall.

Chairman: J O Ritchie

Date: 6 October 2020

item.title: Draft Minutes of the Annual Parish Meeting held on 25 April 2023
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL MINUTES OF THE ANNUAL PARISH MEETING 25 APRIL 2023

The Annual Parish Meeting was held in West Burton Village Hall on Tuesday, 25 April 2023 at 7.30 pm.

Members of the Council present were: Councillors Jane Ritchie, Chairman, Councillors David Dent, Sally Sahin and Victoria Whitehead, and Mrs Sue Ryding, Clerk Also present: Fifteen residents of the Parish, and Mrs Julie Greenslade, the speaker. The Chairman welcomed everyone and thanked them for attending. 1. Minutes of the last meeting and matters arising The minutes of the last Annual Parish Meeting held on 3 May 2022, having been circulated via the website prior to the meeting, were taken as read. Mr Michael Swan proposed and Mr Tony Rossiter seconded that the minutes were a true record, and this was confirmed by all present. The Chairman commented on various actions that had been taken arising from the minutes of the last meeting. In particular, following on from last year, the Chairman asked again for people who lived alone to leave a key with a neighbour, together with details of someone who could be contacted in case of an emergency. 2. Annual Report, Parish Accounts and points arising There were no questions or comments on the Annual Report, but the Clerk, as the Responsible Financial Officer, answered a query about the Council accounts. The Chairman thanked Mr Neil Smeeton for looking after the defibrillator, having taken over from Mr Peter Willerton last year. 3. Coronation celebration The Chairman outlined the details for the Celebration Lunch on Sunday, 7 May 2023, which would take the form of a bring-and-share lunch. She also told the meeting that the Council would be ordering 25 commemorative 5.00 coins, to be presented to each child in the Parish of the age of 16 or under. In addition a commemorative bench would be ordered, which would be placed at the top of the Green near the Platinum Jubilee bench. She thanked Mr Tony Ellender and Mr Michael Swan for their efforts in putting up the bunting, and reported that more bunting had been ordered for the area at the top of the Green. 4. Talk by Mrs Julie Greenslade Mrs Greenslade gave a very interesting and informative talk to the meeting on her work with Good Life Project, a community support organisation that had started during the pandemic and had continued. Based in Hawes and Leyburn, this support took many forms to help people of all ages who were in need. In particular she was pleased to announce the purchase of the Little White Car, driven by volunteers, which could help people who would otherwise have difficulty getting to medical appointments. Mrs Greenslade was thanked by the Chairman for coming to talk to the meeting about this important project, and Mrs Greenslade kindly offered to send further information on the project that could be distributed around the Parish. The Chairman asked that the Parish Council be kept informed of developments and information. 5. Any other business There were no other matters raised. There being no further business, the meeting closed at 8.05 pm
item.excerpt:encoded: A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 3 October 2023

item.title: Minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 1st October 2024
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
BURTON-CUM-WALDEN PARISH COUNCIL MINUTES OF THE PARISH COUNCIL MEETING HELD ON TUESDAY, 1 OCTOBER 2024

A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 1 October 2024

Present: Miss Jane Ritchie, Mr Andrew Landau, Mr David Dent and Mrs Victoria Whitehead, Councillors, Mrs Susan Ryding, Clerk and Mr Richard Nolan, Assistant Clerk. 1. Apologies Apologies were received, and the reason accepted, from Councillor Sally Sahin. 2. Declarations of interest There were no declarations of interest 3. Minutes The minutes of the Parish Council meeting held on 3 September 2024, having been circulated to all Members, were confirmed as a true copy, and duly signed by the Chairman. 4. Clerk's Report The Clerk reported on the following matters:
  • Correspondence with Yorkshire Water
  • Arrangements for Christmas
  • Welcome Packs
  • Council finances
The Clerk also reported that the second payment of the Precept, 3,300.00, had been paid into the Council's bank account on 30 September 2024. 5. Report on Health and Social Care Issues Councillors considered a draft response from the Parish Council to the report on Health and Social Care in Wensleydale, produced by Councillor Denise Houghton of Redmire Parish Council. The draftresponse had been circulated before the meeting. Relating to this matter, the Clerk reported on a telephone conversation she had had with the Chairman of the Richmondshire Branch of the Yorkshire Local Councils Associations (YLCA), Councillor Ian Threlfall. She conveyed to the Council the request by Councillor Threlfall that this matter should be on the agenda for the next meeting of the Richmondshire Branch which is to be held on Thursday, 24 October, in West Burton Village Hall. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should arrange with YLCA for this matter to be put on the agenda for the next YLCA Richmondshire Branch meeting, that the draft response to Councillor Houghton's report is agreed, and that it should be forwarded to YLCA for circulation. 6. Emergency procedures Councillor Dent reported that during the recent power cut, the generator had used approximately 25 litres of fuel, at a rate of about 12 litres every 6 hours. This had comfortably provided light and heating and use of the electric oven in the Village Hall during the outage. Sockets had also been used for electric kettles and re-charging mobile phones. In the light of this information, Councillors considered ways that the generator petrol should be provided and stored. The Chairman also tabled a form that people could use to register with Northern Powergrid as a priority in case of future power cuts. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should arrange with YLCA for this matter to be put on the agenda for the next YLCA Richmondshire Branch meeting, that the draft response to Councillor Houghton's report is agreed, and that it should be forwarded to YLCA for circulation. 7. Streetlights The Clerk reported that she had contacted the owners of the four properties with older streetlights fixed to their houses, and that they had all consented to having a new LED light. This had been passed on to Mr Ian Dawson of North Yorkshire Council. The owner of The Bield had also agreed that an LED light could be fixed to their property to replace the one removed from their garden. Councillor Dent reported that the streetlight near his property, number 11, had been reported to North Yorkshire County and that he had received confirmation that it would be replaced by an LED light as soon as possible. Councillors considered the possibility of replacing the light that had been removed from Peel House, Front Nook, some years ago, with a solar powered light. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should contact Mr Ian Dawson to ask him for more information on the feasibility of a solar light on the Front Nook 8. Half-yearly financial report Councillors considered the half-yearly budget summary, a bank reconciliation (both circulated before the meeting), internal control report and a verbal report from the Responsible Financial Officer. RESOLVED: That these documents and reports are accepted and approved. 9. Precept The Clerk reported that she had received a request from North Yorkshire Council to set the Precept for the 2025/26 financial year. Councillors discussed the possibility of raising the Precept as it had not been raised for ten years. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should investigate whether there was any limit on how much the Precept could be raised, and that this matter should be brought back to the next meeting. 10. New motor mower The Clerk reported that the motor mower was reaching the end of its life and was costing a considerable amount in repairs. The Council considered ways of providing a replacement, including investigating any available grants, and fund-raising. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should look for funding opportunities for a new motor mower, and should consult with Simon Winstanley Ltd on the following and report back to the Council at the next meeting:
  • Whether the mower could be kept going for another year and the likely costs this would incur
  • If it would be possible to lease a mower for the grass cutting season, and what the cost of this would be.
11. Consultation request number 7 on YDNPA Local Plan Councillors considered the seventh request from the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority draft Local Plan, involving the list of preferred sites for future house building. The details of this consultation had been circulated to Councillors before the meeting, and they noted that West Burton is not included on the list of preferred sites. RESOLVED: That no further action is needed on this request. 12. Planning applications Councillors considered the following planning applications:
  • Application R/54/9L for the modification of the Section 106 Agreement on local occupancy to include the whole of North Yorkshire
  • RESOLVED: That the Council felt that the present definition of local' should remain as it is, but noted that Section 106 already allowed, under certain circumstances, the widening of the local' area to include the whole of Richmondshire.
  • Application R/54/7W for a holiday park reception and office and a site-wide lighting plan at Aysgarth Lodge Holidays, Westholme Bank, Aysgarth (retrospective)
  • RESOLVED: That the Council had already commented on these matters in previous applications and did not wish to add anything further, other than an emphasis on concern about light pollution and the need to maintain the National Park's Dark Skies status. The Clerk was asked to respond on these two applications accordingly.
13. Burton-cum-Walden Fundraising Account Councillors considered a proposal by the Clerk, as one of the signatories to this account with the Co-Operative Bank, to close the account as it was no longer being used for anything other than the Bonfire Night event. She reported that there was a balance of 74.71 remaining in the account having recently paid 1,000.00 towards the fireworks for Bonfire Night this year on 2 November. RESOLVED: That the account should stay open for another year while the Council considers the matter further. 14. Risk Assessment for Bonfire Night The Council considered the revised Risk Assessment for the Bonfire Night event. RESOLVED: That this is accepted and approved and should now be forwarded to Mr Peter Wheeler for his information and implementation. 15. Repairs to the Play Area In view of the concern over the high cost of renewing the safety surface under the swings, and other Council expenditure taking priority, other ways of repairing the surface were considered. RESOLVED: That the Clerk should investigate the cost of jet washing the surface and filling in the gaps at the edges, caused by shrinkage, such as filling them in with soil and seeding them. 16. Land by Flanders Hall The Chairman reported to the Council that she had been in email correspondence with the owners of Flanders Hall regarding a small area of land near West Burton Bridge, the title to which had been erroneously registered by them some years ago. The Chairman explained that due to various issues, the owner did not feel inclined to give this land back to the Council, as had been previously agreed. She also reported that she had subsequently taken legal advice on this matter, but that this advice had been that without the agreement of the owners, the chances of the land being returned to Parish Council ownership were very slight, and that the cost in legal fees could be considered disproportionate to the size of the land in question. RESOLVED: That for the moment, there was nothing further that could be done, but that the matter would be borne in mind for the future. 17. Invoices Cheques or online payments were signed or authorised for the following invoices:
  • Cheque for petrol for the generator - 69.60 (VAT 11.66)
  • Cheque for postage and other expenses - 51.29 (VAT 0.63)
  • Online payment to Simon Winstanley for mower repair - 497.87 (VAT 82.98)
  • Online payment to J W Alderson petrol for mower - 62.02 (VAT 10.33)
  • Online payment to West Burton Village Hall rental - 16.00
18. Notice of meetings and reports of meeting attended Councillors noted the dates of future meetings and reports of meetings attended. 19. Items for the next agenda RESOLVED: That in addition to any matters mentioned above, there were no other items for the next agenda. There being no further business, the meeting closed at 10.05 pm Date of the next meeting, Tuesday, 5 November 2024 at 8.00 pm in the Village Hall.  

Chairman: Jane O Ritchie

Date: 5 November 2024
item.excerpt:encoded: A Parish Council meeting was held in the Village Hall, West Burton on Tuesday, 4 June 2024

item.title: May Fair 2023
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
The West Burton May Fair this year will be on Monday 29th May, with lots of wonderful home-made and locally produced goods for you to enjoy.
Taplin & Mageean and Curlew Dairy will each be showcasing their ranges, which will be available to sample and buy.
https://taplinmageean.co.uk/taplin-mageean/
https://www.curlewdairy.co.uk/p/homepage.html?m=1
We have Brymor Ice Cream, our Gourmet Hot Dog Stand and last but not least - the Afternoon Tea from 2pm at the Village Hall.

item.title: Parish Council Meeting to be held on 5 March 2024
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 5 March 2024 at 8.00 pm.

Members of the public are invited to address the Council between 8.00 pm and 8.15 pm at the discretion of the Council.

AGENDA
  1. To receive apologies for absence
  2. To receive declarations of interest.
  3. To confirm the minutes of the Parish Council Meeting held on 13 February 2024
  4. To receive a report from the Clerk on the following matters:
    • Installation of the new archive cupboard
    • Council finances
  5. To consider the use of electric cables across the Green and to consider an email from the owner of Hazeley Garth
  6. To consider the arrangements for the maintenance of the Cemetery
  7. To consider further progress on highways matters
  8. To consider the renewal of the play area surface
  9. To consider a quote of 172.14 from NFU for the renewal of the insurance for the mower
  10. To consider Planning Application R/54/7W for retrospective permission for various items at Aysgarth Lodge Holidays, Westholme Bank, Aysgarth
  11. To consider Planning Application R/54/170 for a single storey extension at Low Wood, Town Head, West Burton
  12. To consider a questionnaire request on a Strategic Housing Market Assessment from the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority
  13. To review the Asset Register
  14. To confirm the date of the Annual Parish Meeting
  15. To consider an offer of a free framed photographic portrait of HM The King
  16. To receive the following invoices for payment:
    • Parish Caretaker to be confirmed
  17. To receive notice of meetings and other events
  18. To consider items for the next agenda.
  S D Ryding Clerk to the Council

Date: 28 February 2024
item.excerpt:encoded: A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on 5 March 2024 at 8.00 pm.

item.title: Parish Council Meeting to be held on 7 January 2025
item.dc:creator: harryadney
item.content:encoded:
A Meeting of Burton-cum-Walden Parish Council will be held in the Village Hall, West Burton, on Tuesday, 7 January 2025 at 8.00 pm.

Members of the public are invited to address the Council between 8.00 pm and 8.15 pm at the discretion of the Council.

AGENDA
  1. To receive apologies for absence.
  2. To receive declarations of interest.
  3. To confirm the minutes of the Annual Parish Council Meeting held on 3 December 2024.
  4. To receive a report from the Clerk on the following matters:
    • Solar streetlights
    • Donation from May Fair Funds
    • Land near Flanders Hall
    • Council finances.
  5. To consider further a request for support for tree planting in the field beyond Croft.
  6. To consider a bank reconciliation and internal control report .
  7. To consider a quote for the renewal of the Council's insurance cover of 547.51.
  8. To review the procedure for the Internal Audit and consider the appointment of an Internal Auditor.
  9. To consider the following planning applications for the erection of storage buildings and installation of 400 litre over-ground effluent tanks at two locations at Cote Bridge Riverside Park, Walden:
    • Planning Application R/54/135F at north-west of Cote Bridge.
    • Planning Application R/54/135G at east of Cote Bridge.
  10. To consider a request from the owners of the West Burton shop for tables and chairs to be placed on the Village Green.
  11. To consider a proposed letter to the Integrated Care Board on funding for General Practices.
  12. To consider further items for the January Newsletter.
  13. To receive the following invoices for payment by cheque and online
    • Parish Caretaker to be confirmed
  14. To receive notice of meetings and other events.
  15. To consider items for the next agenda.
  S D Ryding Clerk to the Council

Date: 1 January 2025
